Align content vertically using a bottom margin.
Uses the `$spacer-xs` variable for the size of margin.

Explanation responsive modifiers:
- `..--xs`: Extra small screens only
- `..--sm`: Small screens only
- `..--md`: Medium screens only
- `..--lg`: Large screens only
- `..--xl`: Extra large screens only
- `..--[xs|sm|md|lg|xl]-[up|down]`: Allows for applying responsive rules _only_ to smaller or larger than screensize

In addition to the standard responsive modifiers, the extra modifier `..-md-down` allows for
applying the `bb-block` styles _only_ on smaller (`down`) or bigger (`up`) screensizes than the breakpoint.

description:
Group a set of elements horizontally. The elements can be grouped directly as children of the `bb-stack` element or
further grouped in sections.

By default, elements are not wrapped to the next line and center-aligned.

The following modifiers are available:
- to enable wrapping and responsive layouts: `bb-stack--wrap`, `bb-stack__break`,
  `bb-stack__break--<breakpoint>-[up|down]`
- for aligning to top/bottom: `bb-stack--align-top`, `bb-stack--align-bottom`
- for aligning to baseline: `bb-stack--baseline`, `bb-stack--align-baseline`
- for aligning specific items to top/bottom: `bb-stack__item--align-<top|bottom>`
- for aligning entire items and their successors to the right: `bb-stack__item--push-right`
- to control the spacing between items: `bb-stack--density-<sm|lg|none>`
- to control the spacing after specific items: `bb-stack__item--spacing-<sm|md|lg|none>`

description:
Notifications are used to communicate messages to the user as a direct response to a user action or as a response to
some internal event.  They are usually optional and dismissible.  Note the difference with alerts, which are usually
in the context of a task the user is working on.

Notifications include borders and rounded corners by default, but with `.bb-notification--flush` it is possible to
render them edge-to-edge in a parent container (like a card or bb-list).
